Dear Mindy Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/10/24, youth was throwing punches and a staff member took
the youth into the backyard where punches were exchanged
between the staff member and youth. Staff member threw youth
over a chair. Youth sustained bruises to their body.
Investigation Interviews
I left a message with Complainant on 04/16/2024 and did not
receive a return call.
I interviewed Youth A on 04/18/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence with another Department of Health and Human Service
Worker. Youth A stated Staff Person 4 directed him to eat his
noodles at the dining table or go to bed. Youth A stated Staff
Person 4 took his bowl of noodles and the noodles spilled. Youth
A stated he threw the spilled noodles at Staff Person 4. Youth A
stated he went outside and Staff Person 1 used both hands and
pushed Youth A in the middle of his upper chest. Youth A stated
he fell backwards on to the chairs in the courtyard. Youth A stated
the area between his shoulder blades were sore from this incident.
Youth A stated a staff person (identity unknown to him) helped
him get up. Youth A stated there were no youth witnesses to this
incident because it was bedtime. Youth A stated he did not want
to continue this interview and returned to program.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 on 04/18/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence with another Department of Health and Human Service
Worker. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A made noodles during
bedtime and ate the noodles sitting on one of the living room
couches. Staff Person 1 stated Staff Person 4 asked Youth A to
eat at the table or go to bed. Staff Person 1 stated Staff Person 4
took the bowl of noodles away from Youth A and placed it on the
dining table and Youth A took the bowl of noodles back to the
living room couch. Staff person 1 stated Staff Person 4 tried to
take the bowl of noodles again and it spilled. Staff Person 1 stated
Youth A spit and threw noodles at Staff Person 4. Staff Person 1
2

stated he stood between Youth A and Staff Person 4 to prevent
further escalation and Staff Person 4 left the unit. Staff Person 1
stated Youth A pulled the front of Staff Person 1’s sweater collar
while Staff Person 1 held his arms out in front of him in a
protective stance without touching Youth A. Staff person 1 stated
Staff Person 3 and Staff Person 5 intervened and tried to separate
Youth A from Staff Person 1, but they ended up outside in the
courtyard. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A bit Staff Person 1’s arm,
tripped, and fell back against the chairs outside. Staff Person 1
stated he re-entered the unit and Youth A tried to get to him, but
Staff 3 blocked Youth A by holding Youth A’s wrists. Staff Person
1 denied pushing or hitting Youth A in this incident.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 on 04/18/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence with another Department of Health and Human Service
Worker. Staff Person 2 stated Youth A refused to shower and
follow bedtime routine. Staff Person 2 stated she turned off the
television as Youth A sat on one of the couches in the living room
eating his noodles. Staff Person 2 stated Staff Person 4 redirected
Youth A to go to bed and tried to take the bowl of noodles from
Youth A. Staff Person 2 stated the noodles spilled and Youth A
spit noodles in Staff Person 4’s face. Staff Person 2 stated Staff
Person 1 asked Youth A why he spit in Staff Person 4’s face and
Youth A grabbed Staff Person 1’s shirt collar and tried to bite Staff
Person 1. Staff Person 2 stated Staff Person 1 also held Youth A
by the shirt collar and she tried to verbally redirect Staff Person 1
to let go. Staff Person 2 stated Youth A fell backwards on one of
the couches and Staff Person 1 leaned over Youth A on the couch
because Youth A and Staff Person 1 were holding on to each
other. Staff Person 2 stated Youth A and Staff Person 1 moved
from the couch and the incident picked up in the courtyard. Staff
Person 2 stated Youth A somehow slid on the ground into the
chairs. Staff Person 2 stated she directed Staff Person 3 to call for
a supervisor. Staff Person 2 stated Staff Person 1 left the unit and
she and Staff Person 3 attempted to process the incident with
Youth A. Staff Person 2 denied seeing Staff person 1 push or hit
Youth A in this incident.
I interviewed Staff Person 3 on 04/18/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence with another Department of Health and Human Service
Worker. Staff Person 3 stated Youth A was defiant during bedtime
routine. Staff Person 3 stated Staff Person 4 asked Youth A to eat
his noodles at the table or go to his room for bed. Staff Person 3
stated Youth A continued to eat his noodles on the couch without
verbally responding. Staff Person 3 stated Staff Person 4 tried to
take the bowl of noodles away from Youth A and the noodles
3

spilled. Staff Person 3 stated Youth A spit noodles in Staff Person
4’s face and threw noodles at Staff Person 4 as she left the unit.
Staff Person 3 stated Staff Person 1 asked Youth A why he spit
the noodles at Staff Person 4 and told Youth A not to spit on
people. Staff Person 3 stated Youth A swung his arms at Staff
Person 1 and bit Staff Person 1’s arm. Staff Person 3 stated Youth
A held on to Staff Person 1’s wrists and they pulled each other
back and forth as she tried to separate them. Staff Person 3
stated Youth A went towards Staff Person 1 after they separated,
and they exited the door in the living room to the courtyard. Staff
Person 3 stated Staff Person 1 pushed Youth A after Youth A bit
Staff Person 1’s forearm and Youth A fell back into the chairs
outside. Youth A bit Staff Person 1’s forearm, Staff Person 1
pushed Youth A, and Youth A fell back into the chairs outside.
Staff Person 3 stated Youth A got up on his own and went inside
after Staff Person 1. Staff Person 3 stated she stood between
Youth A and Staff Person 1 in the kitchen area and tried to
redirect Youth A to go to his room as Staff Person 1 exited the
unit. Despite her previous statement, Staff Person 3 denied seeing
Staff Person 1 push Youth A. Staff Person 3 denied hearing Staff
Person 4 verbally threaten Youth A.
I interviewed Staff Person 4 on 04/18/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence with another Department of Health and Human Service
Worker. Staff Person 4 stated during bedtime Youth A made his
third bowl of noodles of the day. Staff Person 4 stated she tried to
take the bowl of noodles away from Youth A when he refused to
eat at the table or go to his room for bed. Staff Person 4 stated
Youth A let go of the bowl and the noodles spilled on to the floor
and the couch. Staff Person 4 stated Youth A spit noodles at her
and picked up the noodles and threw them at her. Staff Person 4
stated she removed herself from the situation by leaving the unit
and going to the parking lot. Staff Person 4 stated she was not
present when Youth A fell into the chairs in the courtyard. Staff
Person 4 denied threatening Youth A.
I interviewed Staff Person 5 on 04/18/2024 at Mott Children’s
Residence with another Department of Health and Human Service
Worker. Staff Person 5 stated Youth A had a difficult day and this
continued at bedtime when he made noodles instead of following
bedtime routine. Staff Person 5 stated Staff Person 4 asked Youth
A to eat his noodles at the table and not on the couch and took the
noodle bowl away when Youth A ignored her requests. Staff
Person 5 stated the noodles spilled on to the ground and the
couch. Staff Person 5 stated Youth A spit noodles and threw
noodles at Staff Person 4, which prompted Staff Person 1 to stand
4

between Youth A and Staff Person 4. Staff Person 5 stated Staff
Person 4 said, “my kids whoop his ass” in reference to Youth A
and said she wanted “off the unit.” Staff Person 5 was asked if
Staff Person 4 said this directly to Youth A as a threat. Staff
Person 5 stated Staff Person 4 made these comments to her, but
it was loud enough for Youth A to hear. Staff Person 5 stated
Youth A swung and hit Staff Person 1 and Staff Person 1 secured
Youth A’s arm and the incident moved into the courtyard. Staff
Person 5 stated Youth A tried to fight Staff Person 1 again when
they re-entered the unit. Staff Person 5 stated supervisor arrived
on the unit and directed Staff Person 1 to leave and the incident
ended. Staff Person 5 denied seeing Staff Person 1 push or hit
Youth A in this incident.
Video
Videos were reviewed on 04/19/2024.
• Video 1 shows Youth A sitting on a couch eating noodles.
Four staff are on the unit in addition to Staff Person 4
talking to Youth A. Staff person 4 takes a bowl from Youth
A. Youth A grabs the bowl back and sits back down on the
couch. Staff Person 4 grabs the bowl away from Youth A
again and noodles spill from the bowl. Staff Person 4 wipes
her face. Youth A picks up noodles from the couch, walks
towards Staff Person 4, and throws the noodles. Staff
Person 1 intervenes and stands facing Youth A. Staff
Person 1 and Youth A move back and forth in a pulling and
pushing manner either holding on to each other’s hands,
wrist or forearms. Youth A falls over the arm of a couch and
on to his back on the couch while holding Staff Person 1’s
shirt collar. Youth A gets up from the couch, charges
towards, and swings at Staff Person 1. Staff on the unit
intervene to separate Youth A and Staff Person 1. Youth A
and staff exit the living room door to the courtyard.
• Video 2 shows Youth A holding and pulling Staff Person 1
towards him by holding Staff Person 1’s shirt collar in the
courtyard. Staff Person 1’s hands are around Youth A’s
hands. Youth A sits down in a chair and he tries multiple
times to bite Staff Person 1’s hand or forearm while holding
Staff Person 1’s shirt collar. Staff try to separate Youth A
and Staff Person 1. Staff Person 1 places his hand on
Youth A’s face and pushes it back. A staff moves Staff
Person 1’s hand away and Staff Person 1 steps away.
Youth A gets up from the chair and the incident moves out
of camera view into the doorway. Next seen is Staff Person
1 using one hand to push Youth A's back into the courtyard.
5

A staff is between Youth A and Staff Person 1. The incident
moves out of camera view into the doorway again. Next
seen is Staff Person 1’s hands on Youth A’s shoulders by
his neck and moving Youth A backwards in the courtyard.
Youth A falls back on to one of the chairs and goes to the
ground in seated position with his legs extended in front of
him. Staff Person 1 releases Youth A and enters the unit.
Youth A gets up from the ground.
Documentation
• Incident report written by Staff Person 1 dated 04/10/2024
at 8:40 PM states Youth A ate noodles after bedtime. Staff
tried to intervene and Youth A threw food. Youth A became
aggressive and swung and bit Staff Person 1. Staff Person
1 took a protective stance and Youth A tripped and fell over
the chairs.
• Incident report written by Staff Person 3 dated 04/10/2024
at 8:45 PM states Youth A refused chores and shower.
Youth A made a bowl of noodles without permission and
ate the noodles in the living room. Staff and Youth A
engaged in a tug of war over the bowl of noodles. Youth A
let go of the bowl and the noodles fell on the couch and
ground. Youth A spit in staff’s face and threw noodles at
staff. Staff switched out with another staff and Youth A
charged and hit and bit this staff. Youth A would not let go
of staff and the incident moved outdoors. Staff pushed
Youth A into two chairs while defending himself. Supervisor
arrived. Youth A calmed down. This incident was
processed with Youth A.
• Youth A was seen by nursing on 04/11/2024 for shoulder
pain. Nursing documented Youth A had slight redness and
a superficial scratch on his left shoulder blade from the
04/10/2024 altercation.
• Staff Person 1 was hired on 01/16/2024. Staff Person 1 last
completed Therapeutic Crisis Intervention on 01/16/2024.
Staff Person 1 does not have a discipline history related to
direct care of youths.
• Staff Person 2 was hired on 12/05/2023. Staff Person 2 last
completed Therapeutic Crisis Intervention on 02/13/2024.
Staff Person 2 does not have a discipline history related to
direct care of youths.
• Staff Person 3 was hired on 08/14/2023. Staff Person 3 last
completed Therapeutic Crisis Intervention on 12/07/2023.
Staff Person 3 has discipline history of not providing
appropriate supervision.
6

• Staff Person 4 was hired on 06/27/2022. Staff Person 4 last
completed Therapeutic Crisis Intervention on 12/14/2023.
Staff Person 4 does not have a discipline history related to
direct care of youths.
• Staff Person 5 was hired on 03/04/2024. Staff Person 5 last
completed Therapeutic Crisis Intervention on 03/08/2024.
Staff Person 5 does not have discipline history.
Tour
McDonald Unit was toured on 04/18/2024. A basic description of
this open concept unit is upon entering the unit, the dining area is
to the left and the full kitchen is to the right. Moving forward is the
living room with couches, chairs, and a staff table. Youth
bathrooms and rooms are to the left down a hallway. There is an
exit door that opens in one motion in the living room that leads to
a courtyard. Courtyard has a small cement patio with plastic
chairs. Beyond the patio is a grassy area.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance when Staff Person 1
moved back and forth with Youth A in a pulling and pushing
manner on the unit. Non-compliance is also found in the courtyard
when Staff Person 1 placed his hand on Youth A’s face and
pushed Youth A’s head back, Staff Person 1 used one hand and
pushed Youth A on his back, and Staff Person 1 placed his hands
on Youth A’s shoulders by his neck moving Youth A backwards,
which caused Youth A to back in to a chair and fall to the ground.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Staff Person 4 engaged in a power struggle with Youth A
over a bowl of noodles and escalated the situation when
she took the bowl of noodles away from Youth A. It is
recommended for Mott Children Residence to use this
incident as a teaching moment to discuss what other
options were available.
• It is not determined based on the conflicting statements that
Staff Person 4 threatened to “whoop his ass” in reference
to Youth A. It is recommended for Mott Children Residence
to review at team meetings that verbal threats and
intimidating comments are not to be said.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
